features: CORDLESS, 1500W STEAM/DRY IRON End the hassle of twisted, tangled power cords for quicker, easier, more convenient ironing on a variety of fabrics

IRON IN EVERY DIRECTION Sleek, contoured 360° Freestyle soleplate has a double-tipped design to ensure natural movement in any direction. Iron effortlessly forward, backward and even side-to-side for precision and speed
CURVED, STAINLESS STEEL SOLEPLATE Non-stick, dual-tipped soleplate maneuvers seamlessly over fabric without tugging or wrinkling

HEAT, STEAM AND DRY SETTINGS Apply the perfect level of heat and steam, or no steam with the touch of button; a powerful vertical steam feature quickly removes wrinkles on curtains and hanging garments
MAXIMUM PORTABILITY A matching lightweight, heat-resistant carrying case snaps easily onto the iron and power base after use for instant portability and storage
body.description: End the hassle of twisted, tangled power cords forever with the Panasonic NI-WL600 Cordless, Portable 1500W Contoured Multi-Directional Steam/Dry Iron. Unlike corded irons, this sleek, ergonomic 360° Freestyle iron uses a double-tipped soleplate to glide effortlessly in every direction for precision and speed; perfect for everyday ironing and for quilting, crafting and sewing projects. Its curved, non-stick stainless steel soleplate glides seamlessly over fabric without tugging or wrinkling and maneuvers nimbly around buttons, along collars and over sleeves, cuffs and pleats. To use, simply set the iron into the charging base and select the temperature for the fabric you're ironing. In minutes, a temperature ready light illuminates and you're ready to go. If you're interrupted while ironing and forget to unplug the base, no worries. The base automatically turns itself off after 10 minutes. When done the touch of a button on the base smoothly retracts the cord into the base to eliminate messy power cord storage. A heat-resistant carrying case snaps onto the iron and base for instant portability and storage. Adjustable steam and dry settings create the ideal concentration of steam, or no steam at all for everyday fabrics, delicates and easy touch-ups for when no steam is needed. For hanging garments, curtains and drapes, the push of a button applies a powerful burst of vertical steam to relax and remove unsightly wrinkles or creases. And with the Panasonic NI-WL600 cordless iron you can fill the iron's water tank at the sink without having to bring the whole iron with you. A durable, lightweight water tank easily detaches with the touch of a button for no-spill refills. The iron's built-in anti-drip system provides a long-life water seal inside the iron body to prevent water leakage and protect clothing from water spotting. An anti-calcium system automatically prevents steam vents from clogging by reducing sediment build-up in the vaporizing chamber of the iron. Water Tank : Detachable, Iron - Temperature Range : 176°F - 392°F.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Panasonic NI-WL600 Cordless Steam Iron The Ultimate Iron for Quilting, Crafting, and Sewing With its cordless convenience, versatile heat and steam, and a double-pointed soleplate that presses fabric from any direction, the NI-WL600 is tailor-made for piecing, appliqués, crafts, and sewing. Plus, the carrying case makes it easy to take this iron to quilt nights or retreats.

Cordless Freedom The unique dual-tipped stainless steel soleplate is designed to glide forward, backward, and even side-to-side with 360-degree precision and speed. Vertical Steam Power More than a regular steam iron, the push of a button directs a full burst of steam through the soleplate to relax and remove wrinkles and creases on hanging garments, curtains, and drapes. The cordless feature allows total maneuverability.

Anti-drip, anti-calc system Prevents water leakage and protects against water spots. The anti-calc system reduces calcium build-up to prevent clogging for powerful steam release. Spray-mist button Get out stubborn wrinkles with an extra shot of moisture exactly where you need it. Retractable cord reel A quick pull releases the cord and the spring-driven winding mechanism retracts it—quick, easy, and best of all, no tangles or loose wires! Auto safety shut-off Iron automatically turns itself off after 10 minutes of idling.

Detachable water tank Press the release button to remove water tank compartment, and fill the tank without bringing the whole iron with you. Instant portability The Panasonic NI-WL600 includes a heat-resistant, opaque carrying case. Simply snap it onto the base after use for easy portability and storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So handy for sewing!
reviews.reviewText: This is a dream to use for ironing small areas at a time, like seams and hems. The double-pointed shape is wonderful for precision work in tight spaces. It has lots of steam and gets hot right up to the edge of the sole plate. However, it doesn't retain heat for very long, so is not great for large surfaces without having to recharge it on the base. It does recharge quickly, though. Love the removable water tank and the retractable cord. It also stores beautifully in it's own case.I'm delighted to have this in my sewing room but am also glad to have a corded iron for the big jobs and heavy fabrics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best / cutest iron ever
reviews.reviewText: I trust this brand so I decided to buy this item even though it was more expensive than others. I love everything about this item. Best thing is that it is cordless and it has a very good weight to it, it is not super light or heavy. I hated ironing with super light, cheap irons that didn’t do the job.I saw some reviews saying “it needs some time to get warm every now and then”. I didn’t even need to wait for it to warm up after the first warm up and I used it for almost anHOUR. I even ironed the clothes in my closet that didn’t need ironing because it made me feel relaxed 🤭 The whole process was so therapeutic and calming especially because there was no cords to annoy me.It is definitely worth the money, the quality is great, it looks great, it works perfectly and it makes ironing like therapy :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So worth it!!!
reviews.reviewText: This is the best iron I have ever owned. Other than being cordless!! Which is so important to me. This iron heats up fast. Stays at temperature. Has two pointed ends so ironing in any direction. The steam works perfectly. Also the retractable cord glides so nicely. No tugging or trying to push in. This iron is perfect!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight and no cord
reviews.reviewText: My old iron finally gave out after 20+ years, so I decided to go with one of the cordless. It’s a nice iron, lightweight, easy to use and the power station is nice to place the iron and not worry about knocking it over and someone bumping the hot plate. The retractable cord is great to put away when not in use. Not long cords to bundle or get in the way.The only con that I am noticing is that my old iron was scorching hot, this one seems to be much cooler even on the cotton setting. I do prefer the hot setting to be hotter so that is the only downside. But in all I am happy with this iron and works fine for quilting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Skeptical at first!
reviews.reviewText: I iron a lot and since I’ve taken up quilting, I iron even more. This iron is great! With no cord, there is no pulling up of the bottom of a shirt as you iron the top which wrinkles the bottom again. Its size makes it great for quilting. It’s so much lighter than a regular iron because all the heating parts are in the base. It gets plenty hot and quickly, the steam is great. The price was reasonable. I read a lot of reviews before I buy things on Amazon, and mine is A+.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful for piece work, ergonomic
reviews.reviewText: Very pleased with this iron. I have shoulder, arm and wrist issues. I had been using a small Dritz travel iron for piece work since it was so much lighter than what I'd used before. I was looking for a replacement (the Dritz iron has a 2-year warranty, and that's about as long as it lasted). Other reviews comment on the size and weight of this Panasonic iron, as well as the suitability of its oval shape for pressing piece work like you do in quilting. The oval shape means there is less iron surface on the fabric (instead of a wider flat bottom there is a pointed bottom) and that also reduces the effort of ironing (some may find that it makes you somewhat less efficient when ironing large pieces of fabric (backing)--but that hasn't been an issue for me). The surprise for me was the cordless feature. I had not realized that even with a lighter iron, you will be be pulling against the weight/drape of the cord. What a difference! Like others I wondered if it would "stay hot" --this iron has to be replaced in its cradle (not battery operated) to keep it hot. No problem--it stays hot until I shift the fabric (piece or larger), then reheats quickly so I never notice a difference. My other, corded irons, would lose heat, but this guy heats right back up when I set it in its cradle, with no waiting. It heats up quickly, too, when you first start it. Finally, the steam function is very good, and the removable water tank makes refilling the iron easy. I couldn't be more pleased. Amazon delivery was prompt and the box (which shows what is inside) was very well packaged.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This iron heats up quickly and stays hot for a nice amount of time.
reviews.reviewText: I like that there is no cord and it is easy to use.

Light and easy to use, good steam. Shuts off in 10 minutes but reheats quickly. Perfect for mid project quick seams and touch ups. Will continue to use my heavy 40 year old corded iron for when I need to iron an entire garment or very high temp items like linen.
Es ligera, facil de usar, comida y deja bien planchada las prendas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: THIS PRODUCT IS NOT SUITABLE FOR USE IN THE UK
reviews.reviewText: I am puzzled as to why Amazon has this product for sale to customers in the UK. I had found the product through an affiliate link and when the item opened in the UK site I had wrongly assumed that as it was for sale from the UK then it would be compatible to the UK electrical system. WRONG!However I have since discovered that it is not suitable for use outside the USA. I don't think the item should be on the website if it is not suitable for use to it's customers. This is very misleading. I am very disappointed that I cannot buy this item now and have had to return the item. Very disappointed customer.

I fell in love with this iron after using it for two minutes. I am an avid quilter and found the steam and cordless features to be very effective.. it also heats up quite rapidly compared to other irons I have used in the past.

This isn't a full size iron but it's bigger than most travel size. I love that it's cordless and double-ended. Very versatile. I use it for my sewing projects as well as garments. My other irons sit in a drawer. It holds the heat pretty well but you have to set it back on the charging stand every minute or so. You do get used to doing this. It steams pretty well and the soleplate is stainless and is also easy to clean. Love it!
